DataElement.preferredName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills Assessment Complete Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calendar date of a completed assessment using the Assessment of Motor and Process Skills Assessment (AMPS), an observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL); the quality of the person's ADL performance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills Assessment Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 30-item, self-reported questionnaire designed to measure physical and social function along with symptom impact associated with musculosketetal disorders of the upper limb._Having determined the value, significance, or extent of._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._An observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL).  The quality of the person's ADL preformance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL).  The quality of the person's ADL preformance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items.

Concepts.longName: Assessment of Motor and Process Skills
Concepts.definition: An observational assessment that is used to measure the quality of a person's activities of daily living (ADL). The quality of the person's ADL performance is assessed by rating the effort, efficiency, safety, and independence of 16 ADL motor and 20 ADL process skill items.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR Protocol in C3D.
